com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.lde

Class DevToolkit

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.lde.DevToolkit
  • Deprecated. 
    1.4.0 flagged for removal as not fit for purpose and has serious a11y issues.

    @Deprecated
public final class DevToolkit
extends Object

    This component adds a "Developer Toolkit" to the UI.

    This class is WComponent-like, but doesn't use any of the WComponent classes as we don't want it to get in the way when debugging in the LDE.

    NOTE: The dev toolkit affects the entire VM, so no effort has been made to make it function correctly when there are multiple users accessing the LDE.

    .
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Yiannis Paschalidis

    • Method Detail

      • isEnabled

        public static boolean isEnabled()
        Deprecated. 
        Determines whether the toolkit is enabled, based on the application Parameters.
        Returns:
        true if the toolkit is enabled, false otherwise.

      • serviceRequest

        protected void serviceRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Deprecated. 

        Reads the state of the dev toolkit user interface.

        The toolkit UI is implemented in a separate form with a hidden field to identify it, so any request to the main WComponent application being run in the LDE should skip this processing.

        Parameters:
        request - the current request being responded to

      • getRequestHeaders

        public String[][] getRequestHeaders()
        Deprecated. 
        Retrieves the headers for the last request. The headers are returned as an array of key-value pairs.
        Returns:
        the headers for the current request.

      • getRequestMethod

        public String getRequestMethod()
        Deprecated. 
        Retrieves the HTTP method for the last request.
        Returns:
        the HTTP method - "GET", "POST" or "PUT".

      • getRequestParameters

        public String[][] getRequestParameters()
        Deprecated. 
        Retrieves the parameters for the last request. The parameters are returned as an array of key-value pairs. Note that this will not return any results for multi-part encoded form data.
        Returns:
        the parameters for the current request.
